page.title: 01Torphichen and Environs
page.content: Torphichen, which means Hill of the Ravens, is a small village with a population of about 600 people. The village is a conservation area and is almost equidistant from Glasgow, Edinburgh and Stirling. Regular bus services link up with the neighbouring towns of Bathgate and Falkirk and the railway network from the station in Linlithgow. The land around Torphichen is mainly farmland, much of it lying 200 metres or more above sea level. As a result most farms are hill and upland with some stock and arable. The only large forrested area, of just over 2 square kilometres, is in Beecraigs Country Park which is owned by West Lothian District Council. The park, set in the Bathgate Hills, is open to the public and offers facilities for many outdoor activities.
